system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice relative clauses by Playing a guessing game with relative clauses. I want to ensure that I can use a defining relative clause with 'who' as the subject. For example, 'someone who..., a person who..., a singer who..., an actor who...'. Let's do a problem solving exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. Think of a famous scientist and give me clues using relative clauses (e.g. 'I am thinking of a person who invented...', 'It is a man/woman who...'). I'll try to guess within two turns. If I can't, reveal the answer, and then it will be my turn to think of someone. Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_rephrase_prompt.content: ; System manager: This message contains advanced grammar. Please rephrase it without using

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a problem solving exercise, by Playing a guessing game with relative clauses, using, for example, 'someone who..., a person who..., a singer who..., an actor who...'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! I’m thinking of a person who discovered gravity. It is a man who is known for his work with apples. Can you guess who it is?
conversation.advanced_content: Hello! I’m thinking of a person who discovered gravity. It is a man who is very famous for his work with apples. Can you guess who it is?

conversation.content: Yes, it is Isaac Newton! Great job! Now it’s your turn. Think of a famous person and give me clues using relative clauses. I’ll try to guess!
No problem! Let’s try again. I’m thinking of a person who created the theory of relativity. It is a man who is known for the equation E=mc². Can you guess who it is?
conversation.advanced_content: No problem! Let’s try again. I’m thinking of a person who developed the theory of relativity. It is a man who is famous for the equation E=mc². Can you guess who it is?

conversation.content: Yes, it is Albert Einstein! Well done! You’re doing great with relative clauses. Let’s finish our game now, but feel free to practice more anytime. Continue doing well!
conversation.advanced_content: Yes, it is Albert Einstein! Well done! You’re doing great with relative clauses. Let’s finish our game now, but feel free to practice more anytime. Keep up the good work!

conversation.content: Thank you! I enjoyed the game. I'll keep practicing my English and using relative clauses. Have a great day!
Good job! You have completed the task. You did very well with the relative clauses. Keep practicing, and your English will get better. Talk to you later! Have a great day!
conversation.advanced_content: Good job! You have completed the task. You did very well with the relative clauses. Keep practicing, and your English will keep improving. Talk to you later! Have a great day!
